Item.Item: HP TouchPad 16 GB - HP gloss black
Item.ReviewTitle: HP Touchpad is a fun tablet for a low budget
Item.Review:
I managed to pick up the 32GB Touchpad w/ Case, Docking Station, and wireless keyboard (bundled) for $149.99, and it was money well spent.
It may not be as fast or great as the iPad 2 or Samsung Galaxy 10.1 Tablet, but for the price it's amazing. The HP O/S has much need for improvement, but current Android Root Project has an amazing beta that puts the HP Touchpads stats to good use.
Battery Life
I can't complain about battery life. I watched 2 full length NetFlix movies on it without it needing a charge. That was a moot point however (just to see battery life), as the docking station it has charges it and props it up perfectly for movie watching. Very pleased however with the power consumption overall.
Processing Speed
With a 1.2 GHz Qualcomm Snap ... dragon dual-core APQ8060 processor, it is definitely beastly! While it is not quite as fast as the Galaxy 10.1 or the iPad2, it can be reached by overclocking it to 1.4GHZ (which can be done rather easily via a quick Google Search).
I know what you're thinking though, the iPad 2 only has a 1GHz dual-core as opposed to a 1.2GHz. It's the fact that A5 processor the iPad2 has is far more efficient. However once you up your speed on your hp touchpad to 1.4GHz it rivals the iPad 2.
Weight
the HP Touchpad (32GB) is 726grams. Which is 225 grams more than the iPad2. However it is not a "brick" by any means. Still light enough to enjoy your day to day tablet use. I don't know if I would want to hold 1.6lbs for 2 hours watching a movie, but that is what the docking station is for. For that I rated the weight 4/5 stars.
App Availability
I am rating this 4/5 for the simple fact that you have options. You can use HP O/S apps (many of which have been made free after HP discontinued the HP Touchpad), or you can root your device and turn it into an Android Tablet which has a lot more apps from either Android App Market or Amazon App Store.
Design
Simplicity is good when it comes to Tablets, and HP nailed it on the head. Large 9.7'' screen that is crisp with a great resolution, and the screen is 95% of the front face. A+ for design.
Durability
Just like any other Touchpad I have played with (Except the XOOM which feels like a flimsy piece of plastic), this seems to be tough enough to withstand some tossing and dropping. Just the same make sure you take advantage of the HP brand fold case for both protection & convenience. expand » « collapse

The Bad: As mentioned earlier, this tablet was designed to compete with the Ipad, what HP forgot to do was design it to BEAT the ipad... then along comes the Ipad2 and the other slated of Andriod tabs. if this was a year ago, this tab may have had a chance. Its too bulky, heavy and the piano finish loves my prints! Boot times are horrible as well, 3 minutes or so, thought my tab was frozen. along with the bad boot times, launching some apps take forever to load. Just today, DL the iheartradio app, and the first attempt to launch never work, froze. the second attempt worked just fine though. The touch interface lags with some apps and at time even unresponsive. The kicker for me was that quickoffice app, pre-installed, is NOT fully opperational. Read only, no write, edit or create.
Wrap-up: If this there was more app support for webOS, and if HP could fix the lag issues, this could have been a better tab. I installed the update last night as well, but still laggy/buggy. HP should have held off laun ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP TouchPad 16 GB - HP gloss black
Item.ReviewTitle: The HP TouchPad is a quality tablet to use.
Item.Review:
The HP TouchPad seems to have gained a second wind with HP making WebOS open sourced for hackers to turn it into an even better product. However, even with its proprietary WebOS, the TouchPad is a tablet that can stand its own.
Battery Life
The Battery Life with WebOS is pretty good, with on and off usage. I haven't measured it exactly but I have gotten more than 3 hours of usage with it.
Processing Speed
This tablet is pretty fast. At a 1.2GHz Snapdragon processor, it can handle having multiple tasks opened at the same time.
Weight
At about 1 lb., 4 oz., it's slightly heavy, but nothing that would break your back. I have other tablets and while the TouchPad is slightly heavy, it gives a quality feel to it.
App Availability
On WebOS, ... there are apps, but they do not compare to the amount of apps available for Android and Apple. If you choose to dual boot your Touchpad, you can access many of the Android apps (although YMMV, as some may not work well on the tablet).
Design
It has a very simple design to it. The power button and microphone jack is on the top, volume buttons are on the right side, and a central home button. The only gripe I have with it, is that there is a "slot" that's on the right side, that they should have put a SD card reader or something, but instead when depressed, just displays its model type and serial number. Seems like a waste of space to me.
Durability
It's a nice, heavy tablet. If taken care of properly, it will work fine. I have a screen protector on mine and it still looks like it had just came out of the box. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP TouchPad 16 GB - HP gloss black
Item.ReviewTitle: Its better than I expected, well worth the money.
Item.Review:
Pros: Price, Easy to use, Fun, Nice screen, Fast, webOS, HP Customer support, Supports Adobe Flash
Cons: Small selection of apps, no main/rear camera, Sold out and impossible to find
I honestly expected it to be garbage for the amount of money I paid for it. When they dropped the price to 100$ I figured there was something fundamentally wrong with it for them to be basically giving them away. I am very happy to say that I was completely wrong about that.
It is a solid device, with a solid operating system. I am still planning to upgrade to Android when it become available, but to be honest webOS has won me over. I really do wish I could keep webOS, but the lack of applications in the market is frustrating to say the least. There are a lot of useful apps, but no where n ... ear the amount as Android. Other than that though, the OS in my opinion is pretty awesome.
It is extremely easy to use, and even someone who has zero experience using a computer (my grandparents) were able to pick it up and use it immediately. I just had to show them the home button, and how you can swipe between screens and they are pros at it now.
I think it is a great web surfing device for sitting at a couch or something, maybe sitting at a coffee shop and reading some news or something. It is also great as an ebook reader, or movie player. Even if you bought it just for ebooks, you would have paid less for it that you would a not as good standalone ebook reader. So it is definitely worth it. I love doing my reading on it. I have also gotten my grandparents one and taught them how to read the news on it as well, so they have canceled their newspaper subscription. That has saved us 200+$ a year, so it really has made us our money back.
I mentioned video playing earlier, and I want to emphasize how awesome it works for watching videos on the go. I often put my TV series on it, and will bust it out on a long trip to keep my occupied. The quality of the screen is awesome, so it plays videos perfectly.
As far as web browsing goes, it works pretty well. I could only find one browser which is the stock one, but it works pretty well. It has Adobe Flash installed, so all of your we ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP TouchPad 16 GB - HP gloss black

CONS WebOS needs lots of tweaks, using Preware, to turn off all sorts of cpu-wasting processes and logging.
Easily smudged, but who cares for just over a Benjamin?
PROS Great battery life in standby - I get 4 days of light use.
Hardware seems like a solid platform for Android. Excited about this.
OVERALL It's not as convenient as a computer for surfing. It's not as easy to carry around as a smartphone. But sometimes it fills that niche in between. It will probably find a home on the couch, or in the bathroom.
It's like a huge smartphone for dummies.

Item.Item: HP TouchPad 16 GB - HP gloss black
Item.Review:
Overall it's a nice table, which is made from quality hardware component. The display is nice. The performance is good enough for most of tasks. Definitely it worth more than $99. Actually a lot of people will consider buying it for $199. HP management made mistake on the firesale price. It lost more.
WebOS itself overall experience is excellent, especially its multi-windows/tasks management system(card based) is very easy to use. Yes, it's too late to the party to compete effectively with Android and iOS. However, it should not be difficult to leverage Android ecosystem if WebOS can run Android Apps. Many users would love this tablet and stay with WebOS.
The only issue is the localization. It can display Chinese in the browser, but all menus, labels of the OS and Apps can no ... t be changed to Chinese. I give 4 star rating because of this. Otherwise, I would rate it 5 stars.
HP probably made a strategy mistake. There is no way to sell it at $499, and $399. It may be able to sell some for $299, definitely will sell a lot at $199. For $299 price probably it's close to its hardware cost. Since HP is too late to the market, it has to price aggressively in order to be in the game. Now HP quits the game with the firesale $99. Everyone loves it for $99 price. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP TouchPad 16 GB - HP gloss black
Item.Review:
Pros: Price, qualiaty and capabliities
Cons: Really, not much.
Let's put some of these 1 Star "reviews" to rest. If you don't have the time or patience to learn the device, or you're a iPad/Android "snob," then save the bandwidth. The HP TouchPad is a very capable device that does just about everything you NEED It to do. Once you set it up and UPDATE the OS, you'll find it to be a nice addition to your home. I have a first gen iPad which I love and a Nook Color hacked with Android CyanogenMod7 Gingerbread and it works quickly and flawlessly. BUT I'm having lots of fun with the TP. Great email, wonderful speakers/sound, excellent browsing WITH Flash support, MS Office compatible Quick Office HD, FIFTY Gigs of storage on Box.net exclusively for TP owners, Adobe reader, Ki ... ndle, and many others-the ones you will actually use. And, if you search carefully, you will find not thousands, but many apps that are refined and specifically for the TP. The iPad is certainly the better device, but I would put this against most android tabs out there. At these prices, there isn't anything to think about. And once you get used to WebOs, you'll find it to be quite intuitive and easy to navigate. I also believe it will continue to be supported with updates to come. It's thicker than the iPad, weighs more and the screen although excellent, is just a notch down from the Apple device. Jeeze, even if you put it on a stand, connect some powered speakers, and used it as your home entertainment system holding thousands of songs alone, it would be worth more than 99.00 with a touch interface this good. I was lucky to get mine shipped from BBuy but am still on the original waiting list from HP. I will buy as many as they let me buy-Christmas is coming! Don't let the nit-wits or snobs keep you from this excellent device. If you have a chance to get one, by all means GET IT! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP TouchPad 16 GB - HP gloss black
Item.ReviewTitle: Nice but lacking in a few key areas...
Item.Review:
Pros: Awesome OS, Great looks, Good web experience, Great Multitasking
Cons: Lack of support for networking, Little 3rd party apps, Lack of SD expansion, Too glossy
First off I spent a good month researching the various tablets out there for their strength and weaknesses. After my research and talking to a few people I thoght I'd try the HP Touchpad. I knew I was taking a chance with the webOS but thought I'd give it a try.
Main Purpose: Watch downloaded movies in bed, surf the web and play some games.
The good: The Touchpad's webOS is awesome! It looks good, it worls great and is super easy to use without being dumbed down. It feels like a good cross between an iPad and any other Android. Sleek look. The small amount of buttons that are actualy on this thing ar ... e well placed. It seemed very quick and responsive. Browser was fast and worked flash sites well. Display was amazing! At first I was very happy! This thing just screamed quality and design.
Now the bad: I'll start with the deal breaker for me. No support to wirelessly copy over files. I have a computer with almost 2 TB of movies on it. I can connect to it from any other machine even including my Android phone. I called HP just to see if I was missing something and was told I had to connect my Touchpad via USB to the computer to copy over any movie. No 3rd party app support. The HP has no other ports than a mini USb and thats very limited as well. The screen is almost too glossy. Actually the whole thing is. Lack of apps at the moment.
Synopsis: The HP could easily beat any tablet I've tried but it's lack of transferring data over your network, lack of app, total lack of support along with its overly glossy screen sends me back to the drawing board. Item.Item: HP TouchPad 16 GB - HP gloss black
Item.ReviewTitle: Hammer in search of a nail
Item.Review: I had no prior experience with tablets such as the iPad but I waited specifically for the Touchpad to be released. I figure some healthy competition is always a good thing for the consumers and technology. The Touchpad feels solidly built, has a very nice screen/image quality, and has pretty good pep. The speakers have very nice sound quality for music playback. WebOS has a nice user interface design, but right now I'm still trying to figure out what the Touchpad is good for. I have a touchscreen Android smartphone that seems to have more handy apps than the Touchpad does at the moment. I also have an HP netbook with Windows XP that is infinitely easier to use for composing emails, not to mention access to the traditional computing experience and most Windows applications. I somewhat ch ... oke on the words, but so far the only thing the Touchpad does better than any of my other computer-like devices is pan and zoom on the satellite views in the Bing maps application. Being able to zoom webpages is also nice, but not every page behaves like you want it to--possibly not the Touchpad or WebOS's fault, but nevertheless an unfortunate drawback. The email app that allows you to look at multiple accounts in a single view is a very nice idea, but it has a "version 1.0" feeling about it. I recognize the platform is very young so I'm still hopeful for improvements over the next few months. Likewise the calendar needs some work; I have many Google calendars and the Touchpad calendar app seems to be able to display only a limited number of them, starting at the top of the alphabet. I gave my review a "not recommended" marking, but that's not exactly accurate. I don't exactly regret making the purchase, but I do still wonder why I bought it. My best advice is "try before you buy". Go somewhere and put your hands on it. Try typing an email that's longer than a sentence or two. Try typing while sitting down and holding the Touchpad in your lap, too. Make sure you know why you want it ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP TouchPad 16 GB - HP gloss black

Every website that I like worked 100% fine, and while the load times were slow, people nowadays have no patience. Waiting 5 seconds for a webpage to load is completely fine with me.
5.) Lack of SD card slot (why is this a benefit? Well, I found out that HP provides you with 50GB of free space, forever, on BOX.NET. WICKED!)
So, I ended up buying the 32GB touchpad.
I took it home ready to tear the box open and get started with my new tablet!
The tablet started up into a language setup. If you ever had a previous Palm phone with a palm account, as long as you have an internet connection, you can sync up your last save with your phone. How awesome!
After starting up the unit, I found that I could download programs lightning fast and they ran lightning fast. There were over 300+ applications ready to go.
Here's where it took a turn for the worst:
1.) I noticed the brightness was the lowest of all the tablets (but then again, this is my fault for not noticing this ahead of time). It's not bad, but it's very low.
2.) The battery charger provided wouldn't charge my tablet. I got a message (which I will attach as a photo) saying "voltage or current is too low to charge the device.
I tried using multiple plugs, even drivi ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP TouchPad 16 GB - HP gloss black

Cons: Lacks a rear camera (I'll stick to my phone anyway, holding a tablet up for a picture looks silly).
WebOS is, hands down, the best operating system one could find on a tablet!
Its even better on this powerful device! It really is super speedy.
True multi-tasking is incredible! Why hasn't Android or Apple implimented this yet????
Synergy is an awesome feature, all my messages appear in one easy to use app, even Facebook and Skype! Email works the same way!
With "Just Type," I can, well, just type and selcect from my favorite search engines, wikipedia, maps, twitter, and others! Say I'm watching a movie, I wake up the de ... vice, type in the movie title, tap IMDB, and boom, I know who that actress is now.
Soon every HP computer and printer will have WebOS (in addition to Windows), creating a huge ecosystem that I am proud to be an early adopter of with this TouchPad!
The hardware itself is first class. With a real computer producer like HP finally putting their might behind a tablet that's to be expected!
The price is right on par with the iPad 2, and yet side to side, its easy to see the power the TouchPad has over that device!
Screen clarity and sharpness is the same or maybe even better than the iPad 2. And I can finally get access to the full web with flash, unlike any Apple device.
Even though this device just came out there are already plenty of awesome apps to choose from in the app catalog! Since they use Citrix at my place of work, I can not only play, but get actual work done on my TouchPad!
I recommend anyone in the market for a tablet check this awesome device out! expand » « collapse

The hardware i think it is good, after patching and configuring the machine runs fast and great (overclocking, disabling logs, decreasing brightness, eliminating tap ripple!). Charging without cables, with the cradle, is great! As for the software . . . there the starts start falling from the sky (aka, bad performance). The apps are very simple and have very few funct ... ions and configuration options. For example, I cannot print to network printers, i cannot delete the deleted mail from the deleted bin all at once, the software doesn't respond immediately to my tap on the screen, sometimes is a delayed response, others the screen reacts to my tapping, but nothing happens, the software doesn't do what it is supposed to, follow a link, click an option. I don't know if the OS is lost within it's labyrinth or that i has problems dealing with the internet. I use the facebook app. for tablet, and it has very interesting functions and display options, but it is a horrible user experience, 1 out of 3 taps actually do something. and if i'm writing something, an accidental tap anywhere on the screen can make you lose all the writing. I'm afraid to use the tablet for real work, as i might suddenly lose important things because nobody in the developing company took the time to fail proof this things. As for tablet improvement system set up by HP, if i want to look for apps, i have to go to at least TWO places (HP catalog and PreWare Catalog, there might be more) creating a mess of a search. The PreWare site and organization is efficient, open and reliable as a source of ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP TouchPad 16 GB - HP gloss black
Item.ReviewTitle: A fantastic bargain. Best tablet deal.
Item.Review:
This is an attractive and feature-packed tablet thanks to the incredibly discounted prices. However, also owning a XOOM, a Galaxy Tab 10.1, and an iPad; the lag and UI inconsistencies in webOS are quite apparent. However, the Android port to the TouchPad is gathering steam, and we may see Honeycomb or Ice Cream Sandwich (Android 3.x and 4.x) hitting the TouchPad before the end of the year.
As for hardware, the TouchPad isn't too bad. While it is thicker and heavier than any other major tablet, the contoured design helps minimize the unwieldy feel.The glossy and easy-to-scratch plastic finish, however, is a tad disappointing. The dual-core Snapdragon is speedy enough at 1.2 GHz, and most TouchPads are able to handle 1.7 and even 1.9 GHz. However, even at nearly 2 GHz, the OS itself j ... ust seems slower than Honeycomb and iOS. Apple's iOS isn't a fair comparison since it can't do true multitasking other than through a few select services. However, since Honeycomb can truly multitask and is much more responsive, there is no reason for webOS to be so laggy.
Additionally, there seems to be something funky going on with the touch sensor, as I get loads of missed or mis-registered touch events. They're frustrating because I'm not sure if the device has crashed. For the techies out there, a 1.2 GHz Scorpion (CPU segment of the Snapdragon, based off of ARM's Cortex A8 reference design with a few tweaks such as elements of dynamic execution) is roughly as fast as a 1.0 GHz ARM Cortex A9 (the CPU core in the Apple A5, nVIDIA Tegra 2, Samsung Exynos, etc.)
Luckily some patches from PreWare can help fix the lag problem--namely removing the tap-ripple effect. Even still, the software keyboard is almost unusable even with the overclocking and PreWare patches. The auto-correct also leaves A LOT to be desired. I had to disable it in order to have any kind of a decent experience.
Issues aside, for fire sale, there is no better tablet bargain. People bought the Nook Color in droves a ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP TouchPad 16 GB - HP gloss black

Item.Review:
Most attractive part is the price. The IPS screen, 4:3 screen ratio, build quality are definitely highlights of the product. The battery is fine but not good as IPAD2. No SD slot is somewhat concerned.
The major weakness is in the software. I in fact love the webOS at the first place because I was a palm fan before. I am very happy that flash can be opened by the browser and you do not have to install individual apps for different website as IOS. But that is it. Out of box the system is sluggish and you have to do some research to turn off the logging; the update was very difficult to complete without problems; the language support is poor. More important is that there are not many apps available comparing to either IOS or Android. Many people like to have option to read books, but ... HP is weak on this. Maybe because apple and amazon are both selling books but HP does not have a partner.
The bottom line is that after tuning, it is good enough for simple web surfing, video streaming, emails, and limited gaming. It could be better if HP had been more dedicated on the webOS development. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP TouchPad 16 GB - HP gloss black
Item.Review:
This product suffers from four shortfalls. 1. No patience by management 2. Young app community -- not enough apps yet 3. No GPS 4. No camera app
That said, most companies would be jealous to be in this position. The lack of GPS is the only thing that would require a new device. The lack of a camera app should be an easy fix. Apps were being developed, especially considering HP's strategy on the software front.
Now for the strengths: 1. Battery life 2. Slick look 3. Can access it as a network mounted drive 4. Hackable 5. Color ereader 6. Mostly intuitive UI 7. Touch keyboard with numbers 8. Phone shows ALL contacts (Skype, phone etc.) 9. Can tether to phone for calls
Note: it take a minute or so to get used to closing apps by slidi ... ng them off the top.
Suggestions: 1. Keep making them 2. Add GPS 3. Provide a camera app 4. Allow categorization of apps -- three panels is weak give me folders, labels or something 5. Allow contact filter to select users that are online 6. Add close app to the menu 7. Provide a pdf app that allows annotating the document 8. Do something with the desktop -- let me customize it somehow. It's empty and waiting for innovation.
Overall, I'm impressed with how fast this has achieved so much. A bit of a patience might get this product somewhere. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP TouchPad 16 GB - HP gloss black
Item.Review: Comparing the Touchpad to any other tablet on the market is completely unfair considering the vast divide in development for the operating systems. Simply put, WebOS does not have the market that either the iPad or even the Android tablets do, and this limitation in app selection severely hinders the utility of the product. That said, this product still has a mixed bag of positives and negatives and I would recommend it with a caveat. On a positive note, WebOS has potential to be a very intuitive and useful tablet operating system. The syncing across separate systems for email and messaging are fantastic and are extremely impressive. The tablet is also well put together; although plastic and a finger print magnet, I feel it holds its own against earlier generation tablets and the screen ... has fantastic viewing angles. However, considering the competition, the performance on this tablet is seriously lacking. General application usage is slower than what might be expected, and the browser falls well behind the standards available on other competing operating systems. My other smart devices that are much less impressive on a spec sheet will handily outperform this tablet for the majority of what I desire to do (web browser, email, messaging). All said, I don't regret the purchase and would recommend the product at the sale price I received. However, in competing terms, this tablet does not fare well against the iPad or Android in a number of aspects. Although WebOS does have many strong points and the tablet feels solid, it simply isn't worth investing in a lagging ecosystem and sluggish performance. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP TouchPad 16 GB - HP gloss black
Item.ReviewTitle: Great tablet at the right price
Item.Review:
Pros: price, mutitasking, flash, notifications, synergy, touch to share
Cons: limited apps
It's unfortunate that WebOS is only appreciated after death. I am currently an iPad 2 user (and have been with iOS since first gen iPhone/iPad) but I am really impressed with the Touchpad WebOS. I purchased two Touchpads after the "fire sale," one for my mother's birthday, one for my fiance's birthday; as they are perfect for first time tablet users and the price can't be beat. (I am looking forward to purchasing more from the last batch from HP as Christmas gifts) After helping them set up, I am very impressed with WebOS. Notifications are great and unobtrusive and true multitasking is a plus. They are perfect for web browsing and email. The apps are limited but now that there are 500K ... + instant new users over the last week I am sure developers will be motivated to optimize their popular apps for WebOS. In the tech world the lifespan of product innovation is a year at best so for the price it can't be beat even if it is discontinued and WebOS doesn't evolve further; in a year most people will trade up anyway regardless of device. (I sell and upgrade my Apple products every release) I am disappointed that the HP Pre 3 won't be sold in the US but I am trying to get one from the UK (or perhaps an AT&T HP Veer) so I can test out the synergy and touch to share features which are also a big plus to WebOS. If HP could figure out a way to make a great tablet like the Touchpad at the $300 price point I believe WebOS would dominate that market. It's just too difficult to compete at the $500 price point with Apple. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP TouchPad 16 GB - HP gloss black
Item.Review:
Pros: cloud integration, flash support, great keyboard, fast, easy to use
Cons: nothing yet
I picked up the TouchPad the day it came out. After the initial initialization/syncing that keeps it busy in the first day or two (I do have several accounts including gmail, skype, yahoo, facebook, exchange, dropbox, etc...), it is amazing to see how well the TouchPad integrates all of the information from these cloud services into one concise and pleasant experience. You can't find this level of integration on any other tablet on the market today. I do have two iPads at home (original and iPad2) and I was getting tired of having to launch separate apps to access different information services.
The TouchPad is great for real productivity. I can launch multiple browser windows, ... access full sites with flash, use Google docs, read all my kindle books, read the news, read and reply to emails - everything just flows... it's just beautiful!!
I know there is a lot of "emotional attachment" to apple products but content restrictions, locked down functionality and premium prices apple charges for just about anything is just getting ridiculous.
After using the TouchPad for a month and can say with confidence there is nothing better on the market right now. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP TouchPad 16 GB - HP gloss black
Item.Review:
Overall I really like the tablet. I like being able to quickly check e-mail and quickly look up information on the web. I have found very few websites the tablet can’t handle. I like being able to play games on the tablet, having a nice size screen and being lighter than my laptop.
A few things that need work - The Getting Started document mentions the tablet should be fully charged before set up. An approximate time should be included. - There should be an LED light that shows the tablet is charging, even when off. - I had a problem turning on my tablet for the first time. I had to call customer support. All I had to do was hold the both buttons until the unit reset, this information should be in the Getting Started document. - The Getting Started document mentions find ... ing information on logging into a network that doesn’t appear to read the User Guide. Could you have included a user guide? Can’t read it on my tablet since I can’t connect. - There is a pop out door/button of some sort on the lower right side. What is it? Does this mean later tablets will have SD card readers? - No Barnes and Noble ebook reader. - The tablet does a good job with web pages, but there is no way to lock the screen so you can manipulate the window within. For example if you are using google maps you have to use the navigation buttons instead of dragging like you would with a mouse. - Not sure if this is a plus or minus. The tablet automatically synced with my phone contacts. I would have liked to been asked if I wanted my phone synced.
What I like - So far I have downloaded a bunch of free apps, yeah angry birds. There are a bunch apps for sale that look helpful. - I like that Skype is built in. - Web browsing is simple and quick. - All my mail accounts were set up easily. I like the ease with which I can read e-mails. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP TouchPad 16 GB - HP gloss black
Item.Review:
I am a very techy person and love to have the latest technologies. But honestly I had no need for a tablet, so, I never even considered one. Now my non-techy wife, who harasses me every time I look at a new device, saw an HP commercial about the new TouchPad. I was ready to flip the channel. Much to my surprise, almost jaw-dropping, she perks up and says that she wants one. Puzzled, I started drilling her why. She has a Palm Pre with Sprint and loves the interface. She was impressed enough with WebOS that she wanted a larger device to do more of what she likes; photos, videos, web-browsing. So, I promptly got her one.
The free next business-day shipping was fantastic. She had her hands on this one the next day. The setup was extremely simple. If you already have a WebOS phone like s ... he has, you just simply log onto your WebOS account and all your personal settings transfer making the TouchPad personalized similar to her phone. I was actually shocked how simple it was. My wife was like, “so aren’t all devices this easy. “ NOT!!!!
I purchased the touchstone charger and case. They are a huge plus. The case makes it a breeze to handle with the non-slip material. The charger is like no other. Just place the device in the stand; no cords or connections necessary.
For the tech stuff, I found it to be sleek, reasonably sized and excellent fit and finish. The OS is responsive and plenty of apps for her needs. For a non-techy person, she was satisfied.
A couple things that I figured out to improve her experience were connecting her WebOS phone directly to the TouchPad and internet connectivity when mobile. The cell service connection from the phone to the TouchPad was a breeze. You simply pair the Palm Pre to the device. I also set up the phone features to work with her Skype account as well. Now for the mobile internet issue, I was a little concerned since the device didn’t have data services through a cellular provider. But, I quickly realized that my phone with sprint h ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP TouchPad 16 GB - HP gloss black
Item.ReviewTitle: Once you get android on it, for $150 it is the best out there.
Item.Review:
When you take into consideration how HP sold them for $100 and $150, that android has been ported to it, and that WEBOS will be opensourced soon, this is arguably the best tablet for $150 or $100 out there. The screen resolution is adequate, and while the screen may not output as much light as the top tablets out there, it is more than sufficient for use during a sunny day.
Speed wise, this tablet has a dual core snapdragon with a full Gig of ram, so it is very fast. Benchmarks show that this tablet is actually faster than the Ipad 2, which is fast enough for the average user, and even fast enough for the more demanding users out there.
WEBOS by itself is very empty of apps, but it certainly is not horrible. The good thing about this tablet is that you can put android on it, ... with all the apps and games that come with it. The process is very easy if you follow directions online.
The Cons about this tablet is that it is rather heavy, there are not much awesome cases out there for it, battery life is only a day of heavy use with screen set to lowest, and the display does not throw out much light compared to the top dogs. Also, when transferring to the touchpad via USB, it is VERY slow, only 1 MB/s. I have no idea why it is so slow, but something to keep in mind.
Battery Life
About a day of heavy use with screen brightness set to minimum. expand » « collapse

We keep it on our coffee table and we're able to check our email ... accounts, Facebook, and look up various items lickity-split! I had been checking out various tablets since they came on the scene, but the prices were so scary and I really couldn't justify the prices in my mind since we already had 2 laptops and a PC--BUT, the $150 price tag was just right and although HP has decided not to continue with this line of products, it has given us a great idea of what tablets are capable of doing and I will be looking for an Android based tablet in the near future. expand » « collapse

The HP TouchPad shows the potential of webOS. Sorry that the TouchPad itself is now dead, because the way it runs webOS, it looks and feels gorgeous, and is really well set up for the cloud.
The hardware itself was a little heavy, but speakers sound good and the display is crisp. The device really lets the software shine: webOS on a big screen looks great.
Web browsing on the device works great, too; speedy and it renders all the web sites I go to, no problem. Plus the support for Flash is there, a nice bonus.

Item.Item: HP TouchPad 16 GB - HP gloss black
Item.Review: Lack of apps limit this product's capabilities. Camera works well, printing is simple. USB connection makes file transfers easy. Great product for the sale price,I would not pay the original introductory price.

Item.Item: HP TouchPad 16 GB - HP gloss black
Item.Review:
Pros: Price, Quality
Cons: Lack of APPS
I spent 3 days finding the right store and over 2 hours in line. Worth the effort. Lots of cases available on ebay.
It's great for pictures, viewing office docs, web browsing, Kindle reading... and of course Angry Birds. When I place in the charging dock, it becomes a Slide-Show screen saver.
I tried to read non-Amazon books. I had to use the P-reader. The experience could be better.
For $150, it's the best deal in the market, but without more apps it will probably become a picture frame.

Item.Item: HP TouchPad 16 GB - HP gloss black
Item.Review:
Pros: Closeout Price
Cons: WebOS
This is very nice tablet for the closeout price. Screen not quite as good as my I***d but look at the $99 price. I got this to install Android so I'm waiting for the programmers to finish their port.

Item.Item: HP TouchPad 16 GB - HP gloss black
Item.Review:
Pros: price!
Cons: need tweaks to work well
At the firesale price, the TP is a no-brainer purchase. It does everything I need a tablet to do for me. i would say that if the price was $249/299, I would still recommend it.
Need to apply the various tweaks to make this tablet responsive, but they were easy tweaks. BTW, this has the best speakers for any tablet.

Item.Item: HP TouchPad 16 GB - HP gloss black
Item.Review:
Pros: great for web surfing and email is ok
Cons: hardware is bad, camera is cheap when it works and gets laggy quick.
Buggy as hell OS. not sure if the hardware is faulty or the software is at fault. But until Android is released on this, i keep sending it back for all the intermittent issues. Even without the non functioning hardware, its still a great value for a $99 device.. But at it's original price it would be a 2 star item.

Item.Item: HP TouchPad 16 GB - HP gloss black
Item.Review:
Pros: webOS!
Cons: No big company apps but Splashtop makes up for it!
Great OS, if a little sluggish. WIth the new Splashtop Remote Desktop App, it has become a complete system! Fun to use and great community to make the tablet better. AND you cannot beat the price!

Item.Item: HP TouchPad 16 GB - HP gloss black
Item.ReviewTitle: Excellent for what I need, just hard to find
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to set up, apps are still available, can Skype with a decent picture
Cons: Not available any more
Purchased this as a gift for my pastry-chef niece who wants to put all her recipes on it and give up her bulky notebooks. Stood in line on an early morning and snagged the last ticket for a 32GB unit.
She put preware on it, updated to the last drivers, and has been thrilled with the functionality. She's in the process of transferring her recipe files and it's much more portable than what she was using previously. Her boss would love one but there aren't any more available (at the same price).
She does web surf and play a few games, and we can even Skype! Gotta say, this little unit does a lot!

Item.Item: HP TouchPad 16 GB - HP gloss black
Item.Review: Bought the 32gb hp tablet, absolutely love it!!! very responsive, great apps, love the touch screen. graphics are really good, speakers are great. I have only come across 2 downsides to this tablet, and I consider them negligible-There is no sd card slot, although there is obviously a spot where they could have put one and the hp app store is poorly organized, meaning when you search for an app, it is not always listed under the appropriate heading. However, they have over 2000 apps to choose from at this time which is plenty for my needs.

Item.Item: HP TouchPad 16 GB - HP gloss black
Item.ReviewTitle: Great Tablet at an incredible price!
Item.Review:
Pros: It works great, with a full web browser that plays flash
Cons: discontinued, may be the last webOS device I can own
I got in on the HP touchpad fire sale and got this tablet for 149 dollars. Having a Verizon pre plus for the last year has made me familiar with the operating system, so taking to the Touchpad was like a duck takes to water. No major complaints at this price point. System update from HP fixed most of the bugs apparent in the just shipped state. I wish HP had waited before pushing this out the door and into the hands of iPad using tech reviewers who don't get the utility of a true multitasking tablet. Having owned several versions of ipod touch and iPhones, I have no illusions that any tablet will be the final word and last forever, so I'm not worried about ... getting something that has been discontinued by HP. . expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP TouchPad 16 GB - HP gloss black
Item.Review:
Pros: can't beat the price
Cons: lack of apps currently
Did not disappoint and great value for the fire sale price. Now, once Android is available and more apps are for the taking it should be a steal.

Item.Item: HP TouchPad 16 GB - HP gloss black
Item.Review: Amazing Service!! Quick order and lightning fast Free next day delivery. Great deal and a solid product!!! Definitely look forward to doing business with Office Depot!!

Item.Item: HP TouchPad 16 GB - HP gloss black
Item.ReviewTitle: Great tablet with lots of Potential!
Item.Review:
Pros: Price,OS....
Cons: Application&Hardware
Purchased this during the HP firesale, I cant complain no more for that price. touchpad with few tweaks will give you a very nice and fast tablet. apps is limited but its okay. full web browser is really nice, with flash too! limited accessories but with original hp accessories will cover all you need. I hope HP keeps supporting this tablet for few more years!

Item.Item: HP TouchPad 16 GB - HP gloss black
Item.Review:
Pros: Price, Full Flash, Browsing, email
Cons: Beats audio speakers are non-existent, Tweaking required to make it smoother, faster
I bought this during the firesale having never used an WebOS tablet or phone before and i am glad i bought it. It's definitely worth the price......but it's can't be compared to an Android tablet (Asus transformer or Galaxy tab etc) or the IPad.
Very good for browsing the internet, youtube, checking mail, watching movies, has Full Flash :) which is an awesome feature.
Beat's audio is a joke, internal speakers suck.
Some tweaking in required to make it faster and smoother but overall it's one of the best buys of the yr. for me from Best Buy.
Samsung, Asus and Toshiba should learn something from HP and lower their prices ... a bit to better compete with the IPad. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP TouchPad 16 GB - HP gloss black
Item.Review:
I received my HP Touchpad during the $99 frenzy. I could not be happier with it. The pros: Quick response to touch (I have an Archos 101 which is very particular as to how you touch it which is very annoying); screen is clear and vibrant; easy to dismiss the keyboard (another issue with the Archos); shuts off quickly; quick processor; multitasking is the best I have seen in any tablet.
The cons: Slow start up; a little heavy (much heavier than the Archos); no built in stand (which the Archos has); weak word processor is really just a note writer; no access to 3G; the USB port is only for connecting the Touchpad to a PC so the memory is not expandable; few apps but there seem to be more apps available weekly.
It does everything you want from a tablet when connected through ... WiFi. At the fire sale price there is nothing out there to beat it. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP TouchPad 16 GB - HP gloss black
Item.Review:
Pros: Lot's of power and capacity for the price!
Cons: Needs more app support to max out it's potential!
Purchased it during the fire sale for $99, this tablet rocks! I have not put it down. Loaded my music, movies, photos and games without any problems. Love the USB hook up and file transfer, for the non-techie like me this product is truly 'user' friendly. Loaded the camera app and it rocks...loaded Skype am now ready for some 'face time' phone calling!

Item.Item: HP TouchPad 16 GB - HP gloss black
Item.Review:
Pros: Fast, Multitasking tablet
Cons: Can't buy more.
The touchpad is everything you would want in a tablet. Able to access all flash websites. Very fast. The best email of any tablet. I like having all of my contacts in one place. It pulls in all contacts from Facebook and LinkedIn. Plays movies, music pictures. Pulls all of your pictures from facebook. Did I say fast. I don’t understand reviews that say the touchpad is slow. I have not found this to be true. I have 4 and they all work as you would expect. I have not found the need for more apps. The battery life is very good. I can use it all day on wifi and still have battery life left.

Item.Item: HP TouchPad 16 GB - HP gloss black
Item.Review:
Pros: great browser, easy to use, like the cards for apps
Cons: Its a dying OS and doesn't have a lot of apps
I like this tablet a lot. For what I use it for (browsing the web, listening to music through Pandora, and light email) it works great.

Item.Item: HP TouchPad 16 GB - HP gloss black
Item.Review:
Pros: Really nice keyboard and email app..and it has Flash!!
Cons: Some 3rd party apps are sluggish
Love this tablet...and the reduced price is unbeatable. Best Buy is incredible for honoring the firesale price! Best email client i have ever used other than on a PC. The sliding panes are great in apps. Love being able to keep apps running and switch between them quickly...multitasking is unmatched and so is Synergy technology. Has most apps that i would want. With the 50GB of free lifetime online storage i have 82GB total. More than enough storage. Too bad HP discontinued it though. Really enjoy this tablet.

Item.Item: HP TouchPad 16 GB - HP gloss black
Item.Review:
Pros: Browser and speed
Cons: limited apps
okay so I was one of the dudes who stood in line to get this for the reduced price. I wanted another "fruit related" tablet bud didn't want to shell out the $$$. I have been ridiculously impressed with this tablet. The browser is excellent and flash enabled so I can stream videos and movies from sites like Megavideo and others, which you cant do on other tablets. It has many apps that I find useful, like Skype, pandora, angry birds and email, but does not have the selection from the other platforms. Many say that it will be ported over to android instead of web OS but I am not counting on it anytime soon. I would say that for the price I paid it is so worth it even just for the internet browser.

Item.Item: HP TouchPad 16 GB - HP gloss black
Item.Review:
At the clearance price of $150 I thought I would like to try WebOS and a tablet in general. I have found the tablet format to be limiting. WebOS has some nice features, but I have found the browser does not render every page accurately. One big disappointment is that it will not connect to an ad hoc wifi network, so I cannot tether to by android phone.
Overall, it is nice to consume media, but that is all I will use it for.

Item.Item: HP TouchPad 16 GB - HP gloss black
Item.Review:
Pros: PRICE, PRICE, PRICE
Cons: Limited apps
Was able to get this as a gift for my wife at the closeout $99 price...... thank you Best Buy. For the price it is fabulous, at the original price not so much. Limited apps, occasional internet hiccups. Does have a nice display and pretty cool functionality. Hopefully more apps will be developed, if not, still a cool toy for the price; considering my sons TI scientific calculator cost as much as this.

Item.Item: HP TouchPad 16 GB - HP gloss black
Item.Review:
Pros: webOS, skype
Cons: speed, no camera in front
I love this tablet! I actually like webOS better than iOS just because of the "card" feature, its very convenient. I also really like the way Skype works on the tablet, very easy to use, even for my mother who before didn't even know what Skype was.
Maybe the only things that may turn people off is the lack of a camera in the front and the fact that sometimes it is a bit slow. (can be tweaked however to make it go faster)
Overall, it is a great product.

Item.Item: HP TouchPad 16 GB - HP gloss black
Item.Review: Got @ fire sale and got what I expected. It is occasionally quirky, but issues (so far) have all been resolved with a little patience and without calling 4 tech support.

Item.Item: HP TouchPad 16 GB - HP gloss black
Item.Review: I have been enjoying my Touchpad but the quality of the case leaves much to be desired. It is almost impossible to keep the screen clear of fingerprints and smudges. A few times i have noticed that the screen becomes unresponsive although i don't believe this is caused by the dirty screen. All in all, i am very happy with my purchase and would possibly buy another Touchpad if they were to go on sale again.

Item.Item: HP TouchPad 16 GB - HP gloss black
Item.Review:
Pros: Multitasking! True multitasking that it.
Cons: Attention to detail
Lets get this straight, this is a tablet that I most likely would not have purchased if not during the "fire sale". Don't get me wrong its a good tablet but not what it could have been. Webos is great, along with the tablet itself, but after playing with it as one would do you start to find the missed "attention to detail" that other tablets and their os have. But for the price, its the best out there. The actual web browser is the best on any tablet and it would have been interesting to what this badboy could have if not ditched. It could have really given others a run for their money! Root it and overclock it and you have a pretty darn fast tablet at the tips of your hand. Apps are limited but it does ... exactly the same as others. expand » « collapse
